newsitem.title: UK: Powerless Eurostar train towed from Channel tunnel.
newsitem.headline: Powerless Eurostar train towed from Channel tunnel.

text.p: A high-speed Eurostar train with 469 passengers on board was stranded inside the Channel tunnel for almost three hours on Monday by engine failure before being towed out, officials said.
A spokesman for Eurostar said the London to Paris train ground to a halt a third of the way into the 32-mile (51 km) tunnel at 1730 GMT when both power units failed.

"This is very unusual. It's the first time it has happened to a train inside the tunnel but it did not cause any safety problems," the spokesman said by telephone. A pair of diesel engines eventually towed the train out onto the French side.
The incident was the first to occur inside the tunnel since a fire on board a freight train last month injured 34 people and closed down the link for more than two weeks.
Only one of the two tunnels is now open and a spokeswoman for tunnel operators Eurotunnel said the stranded train had delayed several other passenger and freight trains.
